TopicTitle: What are you doing this fourth of July(if you are in America)

Articles.Content: Please share ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Sitting by a fire and watching fireworks. Go 'Murica! Land of the free, home of the brave!

O-O say can you SEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE,

By the dawn's early light,

What so PROOUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUDLY WE HAILED,

At the TWI-LIGHT'S LAST Gleaming?

Whose BROAD STRIPES AND BRIGHT STAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARS,

Through the PERILOUS FIGHT,

O'er the RAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAMPARTS WE WATCHED,

Were so GALL-ANT-LY STREAM-ING?

And the ROCKET's REEDD GLAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARE,

The BOMBS BURST-ING IN AIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIR,

Gave PROOOOF THROUGH THE NIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIGHT,

THAT OUR FLAG WAS STILL THERE.

O SAY DOES THAT STAR-SPAN-GLED BANNER YEEEET WAAAAAAAAAAVE,

O'ER THE LAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAND OF THE FREEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE,

AND THE HOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOME OF THE BRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVEEEEEEE!

> 
> Land of the free\*

\*Over 1% of the population not included. Terms and conditions might apply.

> 
> \*Over 1% of the population not included. Terms and conditions might apply.

All politics aside, a man whose name I can't remember once said "Every sane man loves his country but hates his government". Please don't get political, it always leads to flamewars and the like.

EDIT::

And plus, that's America's slogan and "Brand Image", if you will. The product might change but the advertising will be the same. Plus, it's kinda late in the game to introduce a new patriotic slogan that almost everybody in the country and possibly world knows.

> 
> All politics aside, a man whose name I can't remember once said "Every sane man loves his country but hates his government". Please don't get political, it always leads to flamewars and the like.

It is a factual statement, though you can explain it in a political sense if you really want to. Of course, it is hard to read *land of the free* without a slight cringe if you are aware of the facts.

It's the land of the free if you has at least 3 moni ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

> 
> \*Over 1% of the population not included. Terms and conditions might apply.

I'd love to know what 1% you're talking about... care to define? What are these *facts* you speak of? Are you an American?

Bash it if you want, yet people from around the world - *every nation on the face of this Earth* - want to come here. Maybe you should ask yourself 'Why is that?'

My day was spent with family and friends and neighbors, sharing food and drink and talk and companionship... counting our blessings, thanking God for all we've been blessed with.

*Happy 4th all!*

> 
> Where did the other one go? I liked that one.

What other one?

Gonna have hot dogs, burgers, "root beer" floats (ice cream floating in a soda); watching fireworks displays from roof. Watched movies earlier of depictions of events leading to the founding of this nation. I hope people of all nations will look forward to similar such celebrations in their own countries.
I did a boundary survey of a co-worker's property. Rough terrain, multiple conflicting maps, but we got it done. I got free burgers and beer. Lots of beer. \*hic\*
Just got back from vacation in Canada where we watched the Canada Day fireworks, got back and saw an early show yesterday. Today we'll just light a few fountains and sparklers in the driveway.
i see fireworks

Just got back. Went to a neighbor's house to watch the fireworks (we live in the foothills, so you can cover the fireworks with your thumb at arm's length) on their patio while eating and drinking and having the kids do sparklers, and other small fireworks in the yard.
Mowed the lawn, did laundry, grilled some chicken, argued with the wife, watched some TV, mucked about on the computer, drank whiskey.

Well, what can I say?, that's just *you*. I have many friends here, as well as people I just know, from nearly every nation in eastern and western Europe (not to mention Asia and South America and elsewhere) ... and they're pretty much all working towards their citizenship. They work here, go to school here, vacation here, look to bring their family here. Yes, things have changed, and they'll continue to change - hopefully for the better as we seem to have gone off track.

I will be destroying the commi's, eating burgers, merica-ing (is that even a thing? Who cares!), disliking obama, confirming illuminati, KSPing, getting Jeb to become an american citizen, and eating food.
Did you guys know that the US liberated the Philippines on July 4th, 1946. So two countries celebrate holidays on July 4th.

> 
> They work here, go to school here, vacation here, look to bring their family here.

It sounds like you're working on a biased sample.

The people in question are already in the US, so they are not a good representation of attitudes towards moving to the US.

Anyway:

"Yay! My country is better than your country! The country I'm in is bettar than all others because I just happened to be born in this one!"

Meh. I just don't get it.
